terms.kpi: key performance indicator: a measurable value that demonstrates how effectively an organization achieves key objectives
terms.dso: days sales outstanding: the average number of days it takes to collect payment after a sale
terms.days: units of time equal to twenty-four hours
terms.sales: revenue resulting from goods or services provided to customers
terms.denial_rate: percentage of claims denied by payers over a period
terms.percentage: a portion of one hundred used to express ratios or rates
terms.claims: requests for payment submitted to payers for services rendered
terms.payers: entities such as insurers or government programs that reimburse claims
terms.sla: service level agreement: a contractually defined performance commitment with metrics and credits
terms.service: the action of helping or doing work for someone
terms.level: a relative rank or degree of intensity
terms.agreement: a negotiated and typically legally binding arrangement
terms.variance: difference between expected and actual amounts
terms.expected: predicted or budgeted value based on assumptions
terms.first_pass_yield: percentage of items that meet quality criteria without rework
terms.quality: degree to which something meets requirements
terms.rework: additional effort needed to correct defects
terms.cycle_time: elapsed time from start to finish of a process
terms.throughput: amount of work processed over a given time
terms.on_time_delivery: percentage of orders delivered by the promised date
terms.fill_rate: percentage of demand fulfilled immediately from stock on hand
terms.gross_margin: revenue minus cost of goods sold expressed as an amount or percentage
terms.revenue: income generated from operations before expenses
terms.cogs: cost of goods sold: direct costs attributable to production or procurement
terms.ar_aging: accounts receivable aging: distribution of unpaid invoices by time bucket
